pageTitle: Report: iPad's biggest holiday competitor was iPhone 4S | SanDiegoUnionTribune.com
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {1617=Nobody else was really close. Samsung held on to second place, with shipments of its Galaxy Tab totaling 6.1 million units, or 9.4 percent of the 2011 market., 859=She suggested that tablet makers may turn Microsoft’s upcoming Windows 8 operating system as a way to set themselves apart. She expects a surge in Windows 8 tablets running on ARM microprocessors in late 2012 and early 2013., 2105=“The roll-out of the iPhone 4S in October generated intense competition for Apple purchasers’ disposable income, doing more to limit iPad shipment growth than competition from the Kindle Fire and other media tablets,” said Rhoda Alexander, senior manager of tablet and monitor research for IHS., 1794=For all of 2011, Apple shipped 40.5 million iPads, up 168 percent from 2010. This gave the company 62 percent of the total tablet market worldwide for the year., 3077=Low priced tablets cut into Apple’s dominate market share in the fourth quarter, but the company still shipped substantially more in iPads during the holiday season than it did in 2010.}
